Question
========

Suppose the height of Dutch women has a normal distribution with a mean µ = 65 inches and a standard deviation σ = 2.7 inches. Then what is the probability that if you choose a randomly selected woman in Netherlands, she will be 62 inches or shorter?

Answerlist
----------

* 0,13
* 0,84
* 0,87
* 1,11

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 0.13: Correct
* 0.84: Incorrect
* 0.87: Incorrect
* 1.11: Incorrect
